'''Ken Saydak''' (born [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], [[United States]])<ref name="All">{{cite web |url=http://www.allaboutjazz.com/php/article.php?id=18605|title=All About Jazz - ''It's My Soul'' |author=Slawecki, Chris M |publisher=Allaboutjazz.com |accessdate=May 26, 2010}}</ref> is an [[United States|American]] [[Chicago blues]] [[pianist]] and [[singer-songwriter]]. In a long career, Saydak has played as a [[sideman]] to [[Lonnie Brooks]], [[Mighty Joe Young (musician)|Mighty Joe Young]], [[Johnny Winter]] and [[Dave Specter]].<ref name="AMG"/> Saydak has released three [[album]]s under his own name since 1999. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' once described him as "...a gripping frontman".<ref name="Saydak"/>

==Biography==
During the 1980s, Saydak played on tours and albums by [[Johnny Winter]], including Winter's [[Grammy Award]] nominated LP, ''[[Guitar Slinger (Johnny Winter album)|Guitar Slinger]]''.<ref name="All"/> Following this spell, Saydak became one of the members of the [[blues rock]] [[musical ensemble|band]], [[Big Shoulders]], who issued two albums ([[record producer|produced]] by Saydak) before disbanding.

His debut solo album was 1999's ''Foolish Man'' released on [[Delmark Records]].<ref name="AMG">{{cite web|author=John Bush |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/ken-saydak-mn0000078277/biography |title=Ken Saydak | Biography |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-26}}</ref> Saydak has also produced his own albums, as well as [[Zora Young]]'s 2000 issue, ''Learned My Lesson''. He has now appeared on over fifty albums.

The ''[[Chicago Sun Times]]'' reported "Ken Saydak has built an impressive body of work with his three solo albums and his studio work...''It's My Soul'' is his best stand-alone project yet".<ref name="Saydak">{{cite web |url=http://www.kensaydak.com/ken/index.asp|title=Ken Saydak |author= |publisher=Kensaydak.com |accessdate=May 26, 2010}}</ref>

==Discography==

===Albums===
*''Foolish Man'' (1999) - [[Delmark Records|Delmark]]
*''Love Without Trust'' (2001) - Delmark
*''It's My Soul'' (2005) - Evidence<ref name="Albums">{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/ken-saydak-mn0000078277/discography |title=Ken Saydak | Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-26}}</ref>

*1983 - ''Hot Shot'' - [[Lonnie Brooks]] - Keyboards

*1986 - ''[[Third Degree]]'' - Johnny Winter - Piano
*1988 - ''[[The Winter of '88]]'' - Johnny Winter - Keyboards
*1990 - ''Big Shoulders'' - [[Big Shoulders]] - Organ, piano, accordion, vocals

*1991 - ''Bluebird Blues'' - [[Dave Specter]] with Bill Smith - Organ, piano
*1991 - ''Let Me In'' - Johnny Winter - Piano
*1993 - ''Fortune Tellin' Man'' - [[Jesse Fortune]] - Organ, piano
*1994 - ''Blueplicity'' - Dave Specter - Organ, piano
*1994 - ''Gotcha!'' - [[Barkin' Bill Smith]] - Piano
*1994 - ''One to Infinity'' - [[Tad Robinson]] - Organ, piano
*1995 - ''Had My Fun'' - [[Karen Carroll (musician)|Karen Carroll]] - Organ, piano
*1995 - ''Sweetheart of the Blues'' - [[Bonnie Lee]] - Organ, piano
*1995 - ''Wild Cards'' - Al Miller - Organ, piano
*1996 - ''Left Turn on Blue'' - Dave Specter - Organ
*1996 - ''Long Way to Ol' Miss'' - [[Willie Kent]] - Piano
*1996 - ''Live at Blue Chicago'' - [[Johnny B. Moore]] - Keyboards
*1997 - ''700 Blues'' - [[Lurrie Bell]] - Organ, Piano
*1997 - ''Troubled World'' - [[Johnny B. Moore]] - Piano
*1998 - ''Blues Spoken Here'' - Dave Specter and Lenny Lynn - Piano
*1998 - ''Kiss of Sweet Blues'' - Lurrie Bell - Organ, piano
*1998 - ''Make Room for the Blues'' - Willie Kent - Electric piano
*1998 - ''Ready'' - James Wheeler - Piano
*1999 - ''Knockin' at Your Door'' - [[John Primer]] - Organ, piano
*2000 - ''Can't Take It'' - James Wheeler - Organ, piano
*2000 - ''Learned My Lesson'' - [[Zora Young]] - Organ, piano, producer
*2000 - ''Royal Blue'' - [[Koko Taylor]] - Piano
*2000 - ''Speculatin''' - Dave Specter - Piano
*2002 - ''In the House: Live at Lucerne, Vol. 1'' - [[Bob Stroger]] - Piano, vocals, producer
*2004 - ''[[Have a Little Faith (Mavis Staples album)|Have a Little Faith]]'' - [[Mavis Staples]] - Choir, chorus
*2008 - ''Tell Me Why'' - Alex Wilson - Hammond organ<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/ken-saydak-mn0000078277/credits |title=Ken Saydak | Credits |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-26}}</ref>
